instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio no trackpad
threads.message:
Hello, 

I got this logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> just to be sure, it passed EFI and OS ASD tests successfully. I installed a fresh High Sierra on an SSD and it takes 65 seconds to boot. When running, it does not appear slow, however I get no sound. Icon in the top bar is greyed out. In preferences the output is "Digital out" only, although I get a healthy chime on startup. Also, trackpad works fine but in preferences where I want to enable tap mode it says "searching for trackpad" What???

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio no trackpad
threads.message: Audio jack is bad, just remove <RESISTOR>R6805</RESISTOR> and it will work again, just no more SPDIF. No idea about the trackpad thing, it works so you can only make it worse....
